overview.name: Amazon Prime
overview.description: 148.6 million people use Amazon Prime in the United States while the top 4 leading markets that these consumers come from are the United States of America, Germany, the United Kingdom, and Japan. 112 milliom of these users are members. Amazon Prime members spend an average of 1,400 US dollars per year on the platform, with most of this money going to electronics, apparel, and home and kitchen goods, in that order. 7% of Amazon Prime members say that they shop on Amazon on a daily basis.

overview.name: Whole Foods
overview.description: 10.7% of people who were surveyed stated that they shop regularly at Whole Foods, with all of these consumers coming from either the USA, UK, or Canada. 41.1% of those surveyed stated that they never shopped at Whole Foods, demonstrating the lack of popularity of this supermarket despite it being the largest American chain that specializes in natural and organic food. 97% of the sales generated at Whole Foods come from the consumers located in the United States whereas the UK and Canada make up the remaining 3%, combined.

overview.name: Amazon Music
overview.description: Amazon Music has 55 million subscribers worldwide, not to be confused with Amazon Prime Music or Amazon Music Unlimited. These subscribers are located in the United States, Canada, the UK, France, Germany, Austria, Italy, Spain, Japan, Australia, Brazil, and Mexico. The percentage of consumers who chose Amazon Music as their music streaming platform of choice rose from 27% to 32% from 2019 to 2020, demonstrating how the platform is becoming increasingly more popular behind leading platforms such as Spotify, YouTube, and Pandora Music. Amazon Music is only fourth on the list, ahead of even Apple Music, hinting that this rise in popularity and usage potentially might lift the platform higher on the list in the future.

overview.name: Alexa/Echo
overview.description: 70% of US smart speaker owners will use an Echo this year and practically live with Alexa. Alexa is available in several different countries including the United States, the UK, Ireland, Canada and many other places. The number of smart-speaker owners in the US is set to reach 66.4 million, which is 26.2% of the country's population. There are still more Alexa users than Google users, which is Alexa's direct competitor. Alexa users are known for their personification and anthropomorphizing of Alexa by telling her thank you, reprimanding her, or even attempting to hold a conversation with her. Social disconnection from other humans leads to people seeking companionship with Alexa and Echo. They adapt to individual's speec patterns, vocabulary, and personal preferences.

overview.name: Prime Video
overview.description: 39% of US adults currently subscribe to Amazon Prime Video. Amazon Prime Video is ranked as the third most influential company on the global digital video market. The number of TV shows subscribers get per dollar on Amazon Prime Video in the US is 240. The program is available in more than 200 countries. However, the top five countries with the best value for money, measured by cost per title, are the UK, the USA, India, Canada, and Australia. US prime video users by far have the biggest library of content to watch.

overview.name: Amazon Fresh
overview.description: 15% of respondents say that they used Amazon Fresh during the global pandemic as their food delivery service of choice, placing it in the top five services that were most popular in 2020. Amazon Fresh consumers are in the United States, Spain, Japan, the UK, Germany, and Italy. Also in 2020, Amazon Fresh groceries were at least 3 % cheaper than groceries from its major rivals in the UK, with the biggest differences being between Amazon Fresh and Waitrose and Ocado. 13% of consumers of online grocery retailers stated that they used Amazon Fresh at least once a week, 20% said at least once in three months, and 12% said at least once in a year.

overview.name: Ring
overview.description: In one year, 20,000 customers bought a Ring doorbell. This number increased to 368.31 thousand shipments from April to June in 2020, just two months. This made Ring the second largest smart doorbell consumer base in 2020, even over competitors such as Nest. These doorbells are available in 40+ countries including but not limited to the United States, Canada, Argentina, Chile, Colombia, and Mexico. Ring poses some security and privacy risks towards the consumer considering its foundation on video surveillance. However, most consumers are accepting of monitoring that targets pthers rather than themselves. They are accepting of breaching others' privacy but worry about hackers or other ways that their own privacy may be breached. Consumers are willing to give up privacy, both of themselves and others, in order to feel safe.

overview.description: In one year, 20,000 customers bought a Ring doorbell. This number increased to 368.31 thousand shipments from April to June in 2020, just two months. This made Ring the second largest smart doorbell consumer base in 2020, even over competitors such as Nest. These doorbells are available in 40+ countries including but not limited to the United States, Canada, Argentina, Chile, Colombia, and Mexico. Ring poses some security and privacy risks towards the consumer considering its foundation on video surveillance. However, most consumers are accepting of monitoring that targets pthers rather than themselves. They are accepting of breaching others' privacy but worry about hackers or other ways that their own privacy may be breached. Consumers are willing to give up privacy, both of themselves and others, in order to feel safe.

overview.name: IMDb (TV and reviews)
overview.description: 8% of adults who used IMDb TV in the last year as of February 2020 were part of Gen Z while 3% were millenials. 5% was part of Gen X and 4% were part of the Baby Boomers. Only 3% of those surveyed had used the channel in the past 12 months, deeming IMDb TV to not be a very popular streaming service. Interestingly, a lot of people who go to IMDb to rate films sometimes don't even watch the film before doing so, as can be seen in the case of the newest Ghost Busters movie. Reviews play a prominent role in wether or not an audience will appear. IMDb remains the most popular website for getting information about movies around the world, which gives it a pretty heavy role in determining movie popularity and whether or not the movie will be successful.

overview.name: Twitch
overview.description: 24.32% of Twitch's viewers come from the United States while 6.66% comes from Germany, 4.93% comes from Russia, 4.25% comes from Canada, and 4.08% comes from Brazil. These are the countries with the most viewers. 37.8% of Twitch app users are 10-19 years old, 40.6% are 20-29 years old, 13.2% are 30-39 years old, 7.1% are 40-49 years old, and .9% are 50 years old or older. This demonstrates that majority of the Twitch app consumers are part of the younger generations. Twitch users are found to behave very similarly to the behaviors of popular users as they try to emulate what is acceptable and desired by their peers. They want to be seen as in accordance with social norms. However, some users are able to avoid this behavior due to the ability for users to use pseudonyms. Some of the most popular streamers on Twitch are Fextralife, Riot Games, and ShadbaseMurderTV, so many viewers can be seen as copying social behaviors of these popular streamers.

overview.name: Goodreads
overview.description: Goodreads has 90 million registered members, and that number is on an uphill climb. 10% of these members say they bring one book on vacation, 23% say they bring 2 books, 24% say 3 books, 12% say 4, 9% say 5, 7% say 6 to 9 books, and 15% say 10 or more books. This indicates that members of Goodreads not only are members, but they are active members who really love to read and participate in the site. Goodreads acts as a social networking site, combining the idea behind the generic social networking sites such as Facebook with book-related features. Book recommendations are a huge form of networking on Goodreads that any member can be part of on any given day. The site helps inform librarians for purchase strategies due to this large amount of book recommendations by the members. Members also affect the success of the authors on the site and therefore have a lot of power. If members deem an author as unprofessional, then there will be major consequences for that author.
